g.title: Rectangle
g.desc: Software entities (classes, modules, functions, etc) should b...
g.text: Software entities (classes, modules, functions, etc) should be open for extension, but closed for modification.

g.title: Rectangle.7
g.desc: Less likely to introduce bugs in code we don’t touch
g.text: Less likely to introduce bugs in code we don’t touch

g.title: Rectangle.16
g.desc: Complexity will grow when applying to much abstractions.
g.text: Complexity will grow when applying to much abstractions.

g.title: Rectangle.31
g.desc: <<overcome>> Re-test existing code, because it is modified
g.text: <<overcome>>Re-test existing code, because it is modified

g.title: Folded Corner.59
g.desc: Let’s say we have a class AreaCalculator that calculates the ...

g.text: Let’s say we have a class AreaCalculator that calculates the areas of different shapes and adds them up. It uses a switch case to determine the shape type. This however violates ‘open-closed’, because we have to adjust the switch case for each new shape. To resolve this issue we can shift responsibility. Each concrete class contains its own way of calculating the area. Adding new shapes can be done by adding a new class and inheriting from the base. The AreaCalculator has now no knowledge about how the area of a shape should be calculated. The responsibility is shifted to the concrete shapes. The AreaCalculator had first multiple reasons to changes, namely for each shape area. Now it only has one reason to change, namely what it does with the overall calculated areas.

g.title: Folded Corner.44
g.desc: Creating new classes, functions or modules, which we can use ...

g.text: Creating new classes, functions or modules, which we can use as an extension on the existing code will result in less bugs, because we are not messing around in existing and maybe unfamiliar territory. This causes a high level of stability in a software system.

g.title: Folded Corner.47
g.desc: To accomplish ‘open-closed’ we often obscure the concrete imp...

g.text: To accomplish ‘open-closed’ we often obscure the concrete implementation (shift the responsibility to the correct module). This results in less knowledge of a concrete type within a system resulting in fewer conditionals. (See example above of single responsibility for more clarity).

g.title: Folded Corner.53
g.desc: Modifying existing code means we have to modify our tests cod...

g.text: Modifying existing code means we have to modify our tests code/cases (change of breaking is higher) and retest all the code that might be touched by the change. This results in more maintenance and brings more complexity. (We now need to have knowledge about all the test cases as well!)

g.title: Folded Corner.56
g.desc: Adjusting a module means we have to recompile the module and ...

g.text: Adjusting a module means we have to recompile the module and maybe other modules whom are affect by the change, but are not interested in it directly. Extending the functionality means we only have to recompile the part that is extended and only the modules whom are dependent on it. In large codebases this could safe time.
